mods.abstract: $1000 Reward. SOMETIME in November last, two negro fellows, NED and WATT, absented themselves from this place, and it is supposed they were enticed away by a white man. NED is about 26 years old, has very black complexion, is of small statue, not more than 5 feet 6 inches high, wears long bushy hair, answers loud and quickly when spoken to. WATT is 21 years of age; his complexion, is between a black and copper; he is about 5 feet 10 inches in height; a well formed and formed and fine looking negro. The above reward will be given for the delivery of the thief and negroes in Shreveport, or a proportional amount for either of them W. G. BONNER & Co. Shreveport, April 13, 1859.4t
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
